question.text: Which of the given statements is NOT CORRECT regarding colour blindness?

options.text: It is more common in males than in females.
Homozygous recessive condition is required for the expression of colour blindness in females.
Males can be carriers of the trait.
Colour blind women always have a colourblind father and always produce a colour blind son.

solution.text:
X-linked disorders are inherent disorders due to mutation in the X-chromosome which causes the phenotype to be always expressed in male and in female only in homozygous condition.

Colour blindness is a X-linked recessive disorder. In colour blindness, the affected individual is not able to distinguish colour especially red and green.

The son will always be colour blind if he has a colour blind mother.

Since the affected chromosome is X chromosome and not Y, the only female can be carriers in heterozygous condition.
